Incident.Summary: Removal of stolen firearm from NCIC

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
On April 19, 2023, I (Sgt. D. Feltman, Maryland State Police, Criminal Enforcement Division, Firearms Enforcement Unit) received a FRU (Firearms Registration Unit) disapproval from MSP Licensing division related to application # 2023040836 related to a possible stolen firearm.  The firearm in question, Smith and Wesson, 65-2, .357, S/N- 7D61514, was reported stolen through the Littleton Police Department (Massachusetts) on January 8, 2003.  This firearm was part of a multi purchase application submitted by a subject identified as Brian Frederick Leyh, W/M, 05/30/67, 5816 Wyndham Circle, Columbia, MD 21044.  The Smith and Wesson was removed from the original application (2023040836) and the remaining firearms were approved for transfer.  

     On April 24, 2023, multiple calls were made to the originating agency (Littleton PD in Massachusetts) where it was determined the original owner was deceased with no next of kin identified.  As a result, Littleton PD did not want the firearm back.  A detective with Littleton PD (Det. P. O'Donoghue) advised a hit and locate would need to be sent before removing the firearm from NCIC.  As a result, I contacted the dealer (2A Sales and Supplies, LLC) and advised them of the status.  The gentleman I spoke to (Robert Wengert) advised they did not understand why the firearm was removed from the original application and subsequently submitted another application (# 2023040833) for just the one (1) firearm listed above.  While reviewing in the Licensing portal, I noticed the application was submitted to Licensing on 4/22/23 and was being reviewed.  

     On April 26, 2023, I responded to 2A Sales and Supplies located at 8610 Washington Blvd., #209, Jessup, MD 20794, and made contact with Robert Wengert who produced the alleged stolen firearm.  I subsequently verified the S/N of 7D61514 and proceeded to contact police communications operator (PCO) Palmer from the Waterloo Barrack.  PCO Palmer confirmed that she sent the hit and locate to Littleton PD.  The firearm was subsequently removed from NCIC and the handgun was returned to 2A Sales and Supplies staff for resale.

     Case Closed.
